metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3253 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The MethodClosure class in runtime/MethodClosure.java in Apache Groovy1.7.0 through 2.4.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code orcause a denial of service via a crafted serialized object.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

groovy2 - 2.5.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: groovy: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
groovy2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.4-1').
